questions.question_text: Which component of a Cisco Nexus 1000V Series switch is responsible for propagating configurations to virtual switches?

discussion.content: C: The Cisco Nexus 1000V Series VSM controls multiple VEMs as one logical modular distributed virtual switch. Configuration is performed through the VSM and is automatically propagated to the VEMs.

questions.answer_description:
Product Architecture -
The Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switch has two major components (Figure 1): the virtual Ethernet module (VEM), which runs inside the hypervisor, and the virtual supervisor module (VSM), which manages the VEMs.

Virtual Supervisor Module -
The Cisco Nexus 1000V Series VSM controls multiple VEMs as one logical modular distributed virtual switch. Configuration is performed through the VSM and is automatically propagated to the VEMs.
Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/switches/nexus-1000v-switch-vmwarevsphere/data_sheet_c78-492971.html

choices.A: Fibre Channel ports should be configured consecutively from the last port of a module.
choices.D: Port type changes become effective only after reloading the switch.
choices.C: Fibre Channel ports should be configured consecutively from the first port of a module.
choices.E: Fibre Channel ports may be assigned to any available port without regard to switch location.
choices.B: Port type changes become effective immediately after configuration.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about how universal ports are converted from Ethernet to Fibre Channel ports are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
AD not AB, needs restart:
If you are changing the port type from Ethernet port mode to Fibre Channel port mode, or vice-versa, the following warning appears:
Warning: This operation will change the port mode (from Ethernet to FC or vice-versa). When committed, this change will require the module to restart.
Source: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Storage-Mgmt/3-2/b_CLI_UCSM_Storage_Management_Guide_3_2/b_CLI_UCSM_Storage_Management_Guide_3_2_chapter_010.html
It's AB, and means from the last Network port.

choices.A: the amount of memory on the blade servers
choices.D: the number of applications on the desktop of each user
choices.C: the hypervisor version and the virtual desktop infrastructure software
choices.F: the percentage of user desktops that need remote access
choices.B: the CPU speed of the blade servers
